org.jgrapes.core

Interface Criterion

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Channel, DefaultChannel, IOSubchannel, Self
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Accepted, Attached, ClassChannel, Close, Closed, CompletedEvent, Component, ConnectRequest, DeleteRequest, Detached, EndOfRequest, Error, Event, EventBase, FileOpened, FileStorage, GetRequest, Handler.NO_CHANNEL, Handler.NO_EVENT, HandlingError, HandlingErrorPrinter, HeadRequest, HttpServer, Input, IOError, IOSubchannel.DefaultSubchannel, LinkedIOSubchannel, NamedChannel, NamedEvent, NioDispatcher, NioRegistration, NioRegistration.Completed, Opened, OptionsRequest, Output, PostRequest, PutRequest, Ready, Request, Request.Completed, Response, SaveInput, SaveOutput, Server, Server.Connection, Start, Started, StaticContentDispatcher, Stop, StreamFile, TraceRequest

    public interface Criterion
    This interface provides a mechanism for matching an object against a value that identifies the object. Objects that have a unique name can, for example, provide their name as match value. Given this value, it is then possible to search through a collection of objects and identify the object as the one that returns true for isMatchedBy(Object).

    In addition to its own match value, a Criterion can also be matched by some other value, e.g. a value that represents a wildcard (objects with unique names could consider their names being matched by their name and "*"). The interpretation of isMatchedBy(Object) is completely up to the class that implements it. It should, however, return true when called with the value obtained from getMatchValue().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object getMatchValue()
      Returns a sample value that matches this criterion and is unique for the class or object that provides it.
      boolean isMatchedBy(Object value)
      Returns true if this Criterion is met by the provided value.
